title: Joe Philbin (rugby league)
text:
Joe Philbin is a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and for the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>. He has played for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a>, <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and the <a href="England%20Knights">England Knights</a> at international level.
He has spent time on loan from <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> at the <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton Lions</a> and the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>, and the <a href="North%20Wales%20Crusaders">North Wales Crusaders</a> in <a href="2015%20Championship%201">Championship 1</a> and the <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> in <a href="2016%20League%201">League 1</a>.
Background.
Philbin was born in <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
Played his junior rugby at local amateur clubs Culcheth Eagles and Latchford Albion before joining Warrington Wolves, aged 16.
Warrington Wolves.
He broke into the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> first team in 2014. His début was against the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>, where he unfortunately picked up a hip injury. Joe returned for the first team a month later against the London Broncos.
Philbin scored his first career try against the <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a> in February 2015, and the following week he scored again, this time against <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>.
He played in the <a href="2018%20Challenge%20Cup%20Final">2018 Challenge Cup Final</a> defeat by the <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
He played in the <a href="2018%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2018 Super League Grand Final</a> defeat by the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.
He played in the <a href="2019%20Challenge%20Cup%20Final">2019 Challenge Cup Final</a> victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
Bradford.
He was sent on a month's loan to <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> side <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in January 2014.
Swinton.
Joe has featured in 2 matches via dual registration for <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a>, and scored 1 try.
International career.
In 2016 he was called up to the <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> squad for the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%E2%80%93%20Europe%23Group%20B">2017 Rugby League World Cup European Pool B qualifiers</a>.
In 2018 he was selected for the <a href="England%20Knights">England Knights</a> on their tour of <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>. He played against <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> at the <a href="Lae%20Football%20Stadium">Lae Football Stadium</a> and the <a href="Oil%20Search%20National%20Football%20Stadium">Oil Search National Football Stadium</a>.
He was added to the <a href="Great%20Britain%20Lions">Great Britain Lions</a> Elite Performance squad in September 2019.
He was selected in squad for the <a href="2019%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour">2019 Great Britain Lions tour</a> of the Southern Hemisphere.
